description: Automorphic primes: p such that p^p ends with the digits of p.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
example: 11 is in the sequence because 11 is prime and 11^11=285311670611 ends in 11.
mathematica: Select[ Prime@ Range@863, PowerMod[ #, #, 10^Floor[Log[10, # ] + 1]] == # &] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_ Sep 25 2006 *)Select[Prime[Range[850]],PowerMod[#,#,10^IntegerLength[#]]==#&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Mar 05 2015 *)
author: _G. L. Honaker, Jr._, Jan 30 2000
extensions: More terms from Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Jan 02 2002
